thread.title: No setbacks for Texans Pro Bowl left tackle Duane Brown
thread.title_full: No setbacks for Texans Pro Bowl left tackle Duane Brown

author: Aaron Wilson
title: No setbacks for Texans Pro Bowl left tackle Duane Brown
text:
Image 1 of 11 | John McClain's Week 5 grades Brett Coomer / Houston Chronicle QUARTERBACKS Ryan Mallett didn’t play well and left after he was drilled in the chest. Brian Hoyer played too well to be removed and kept the Texans in the game with an impressive performance. Grade: C Image 1 of 11 - John McClain's Week 5 grades

Grade: F Image 11 of 11 Image 11 of 11 - John McClain's Week 5 grades gallery_thumbs_close|ultimatetexans-2348-post-70925-g35956|ultimatetexans-2348-post-70925-g35956|0 No setbacks for Texans Pro Bowl left tackle Duane Brown Back to Gallery gallery_thumbs_close|loaded-2432-post-2857-g24417|loaded-2432-post-2857-g24417|0 gallery_overlay_close|ultimatetexans-2348-post-70925-g35956|ultimatetexans-2348-post-70925-g35956|0 
Texans Pro Bowl left offensive tackle Duane Brown didn’t experience any setbacks with his broken right thumb while playing two football games last week in five days. 
Brown has now started two consecutive games after dealing with the thumb injury suffered during the preseason after aggravating the injury against the Kansas City Chiefs in the season opener. 
“It’s feeling great,” Brown said. “The healing process has been good. I’m feeling stronger in it every week.” 
aaron.wilson@chron.com
